Node.definition: = action by which humans supervise, direct or oversee work (such as building or repairing) or worship (such as singing or playing instruments)
= a type of song (שִׁיר) probably to be accompanied by musical instruments
= man; ◄ son of Jesse (יִשַׁי) ► king of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth
= process by which someone experiences extreme fear, ► which may be accompanied by visible symptoms such as trembling
= person who has a conflict with someone else and acts accordingly

Node.gloss: to watch over|to guard|to be in charge of|to take care of|to protect|to tend|to keep
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities make sure that an object is safe from harm; ◄ by observing the object and the surrounding area carefully and intervening when necessary

= the state of being alive and well; ◄ because of the presence of air to breathe and food to eat; ≈ life is regarded as more than a mere physical condition; in many cases it includes health, strength, and some degree of prosperity
= causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans to go to a location where they will not be readily seen or where danger cannot reach them
= a decision or advice of a group of persons, often secret and sometimes harmful to another

Node.gloss: to act wickedly|to do wickedness|to do evil
Node.definition: = action by which humans behave in an evil or harmful way
= a relatively large group of people
= action by which a person or deity carries out some purposeful activity, in order to create something or cause something to happen
= great wickedness and depravity, as a trait of certain human beings, which is expressed in thoughts, words, and actions; ≈ regarded as unacceptable and worthy of punishment by God
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= offensive weapon consisting of long blade for cutting or thrusting or both, and hilt with hand guard; ◄ made out of iron; ► used in warfare; ≈ symbol of aggression and punishment
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking
= action by which humans point an arrow at a target

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= state in which humans are in a state of anger, lack compassion, and do not tolerate any opposition
= causative action by which humans launch arrows (חֵץ) with the help of a bow (קֶשֶׁת)
= a place where humans or animals go in order to not be readily seen by others, ► either to keep safe from danger or to attack others
= causative action by which humans launch arrows (חֵץ) with the help of a bow (קֶשֶׁת)

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= causative action by which humans cause other humans to be mentally strong and able to deal with issues relating their daily work, good leadership, and war
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong

Node.gloss: to tell|to recount|to proclaim: to declare
Node.definition: = action by which humans communicate verbally to others about an event or situation, with focus on the contents rather than on the speech act
= causative action by which humans cause other humans or objects to be invisible so that their location cannot be determined, which is often achieved by burying them or by covering them
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= action by which humans exercise their minds ► in order to understand certain things or to make a plan
= the state of being or acting in an unjust or morally evil way
= action by which humans exercise their minds ► in order to make a plan
= action by which humans exercise their minds ► in order to understand certain things or to make a plan
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
= causative action by which humans launch arrows (חֵץ) with the help of a bow (קֶשֶׁת)
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

= pointed missile, shot from a bow; slender and straight in shape and moving swiftly; ◄ made out of wood and/or iron; ► mainly used for hunting, in warfare, and occasionally for divination; ≈ symbol of aggression, affliction, and punishment
= area of physical damage on the body; ◄ caused by an act of aggression

Node.gloss: to cause to stumble|to cause to fail
Node.definition: literally: to cause to stumble; hence: = causative process by which humans or deities cause (other) humans not to live up to the expectations others have of them
= the fleshy organ in the mouth, used for tasting, licking, swallowing, and (in the case of humans) speaking

= process by which humans shake or tremble violently and involuntarily, ◄ caused by fear or another unnerving experience|literally: to shake (one's head) = action by which humans turn their head from one side to the other ► to express scorn and derision

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something

Node.gloss: to be afraid|to fear|to be in awe of|to revere
Node.definition: = state in which humans experience fear
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
plural with singular meaning: = the highest God, creator of heaven and earth

Node.gloss: to consider|to ponder|to observe|to take note of|to have regard for|to give heed to|to study
Node.definition: = action by which humans think about someone or something accompanied by a willingness to translate their conclusions into action if needed
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
= state in which a person's or deity's behavior is fully consistent with the requirements of the law, either in a specific matter that is under dispute or as one's general mode of behavior
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans who find themselves in difficult circumstances put their trust in someone else, ► in order to find protection or safety
= state in which humans experience great joy and act accordingly
= person whose behavior is morally and ethically right
literally: heart; hence: = the seat of knowledge, human reasoning, planning, intelligence, skill, affection and hatred, desire and satisfaction, humility and pride, courage and fear, joy and grief
